Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: Crop Science products mainly comprise three key product segments, (1) herbicides, (2) insecticides and (3) fungicides, which are applied to improve crop yields and increase efficiency of crop production for products such as corn, wheat or soybeans. In 2022, total revenue of the underlying global Crop Science market amounted to €69.6 billion, growing at a CAGR of 7.8% from €55.6 billion in 2019 (Roland Berger Report). Out of the approximately €70 billion Crop Science market, active ingredients (including advanced intermediates) manufacturing accounted for approximately €13-17 billion. Active ingredients refer to the chemical compound that is used in the final crop protection product and achieves the desired counteractive properties against pests, such as weeds, insects and fungi, among other organisms. Active ingredients manufacturing refers to a multi-step manufacturing process of the key chemical ingredient within crop protection products that imparts the biological activity to the crop protection products. Within the active ingredient manufacturing market, around 40-50% of the production is outsourced to CDMOs such as us, implying a total addressable Crop Science CDMO market for the CABB Group (“CABB”) of approximately €6.5-7.0 billion in 2022 (Roland Berger Report). See “⸺Crop _Science⸺CDMO.”_

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: Demand for crop protection products is primarily driven by farmer demand. Increasing demand is expected due to two underlying long-term mega-trends, which overall positively affect the Crop Science market: (1) the growing population and rising middle class; and (2) decreasing arable land per capita. Population growth and the consequent increase in food demand, which, taken with the reduction in arable land per capita available, will drive a strong need for more efficient, higher-priced innovative crop protection products capable of improving farmland yields on available areas (Roland Berger Report). _Growing population and rising middle class_ Growing global population leads to an increased demand for food and crops. Additionally, a higher caloric intake per capita and a fast-growing global middle class also positively impact the future demand for food supply. The total world population is expected to grow at a CAGR of 0.9% from approximately 7.8 billion in 2020 to 8.5 billion in 2030, down from a slightly higher CAGR of 1.2% between 2000 and 2020 (Roland Berger Report). The global middle class population (i.e., households with per capita income between US$10 and US$100 per person per day) drives a stronger demand for food and crops and has grown at a CAGR of 4.4%, from 3.0 billion in 2015 to 3.8 billion in 2020. Forecasts predict a further CAGR of 3.7% from 2020 to 2030 (Roland Berger Report). 90 ----- Source: Roland Berger Report 1) Defined as households with per capita incomes between USD 10 and USD 100 per person per day (pppd) in 2005 PPP terms _Decreasing arable land per capita_ Although arable land has grown slightly in absolute terms, it has decreased in relation to the increasing global population. Available hectares per capita have declined at a rate of -1.1% CAGR from 2000 to 2020 (Roland Berger Report). As a result, achieving target crop yields per hectare within available areas to support an increasing population requires greater efficiency in crop protection, which fosters the need for efficient Crop Science products (Roland Berger Report). Source: Roland Berger Report _Increased prices for crop commodities since 2020_ Prices of crop commodities are a major factor for the Crop Science market, since high (or low) trading prices generally lead to increased (or reduced) farmer income, and as a result increase (or decrease) farmers’ ability to spend on Crop Science products. Furthermore, farmers are increasingly using tools such as digital monitoring of crop areas, which allows them to use more precise, accurate and sophisticated Crop Science products (e.g., small batches and/or targeted applications) to enhance their crop yields. After a long period of stagnation, the prices of 91 ----- crop commodities surged in the second half of 2020 due to increased demand and supply imbalance caused by strong demand from China, unfavorable weather conditions and COVID-19, which led to supply chain interruptions. Similarly, prices have sharply increased in the first half of 2022 as a result of the energy crisis and the overall inflationary environment among other factors. At the end of 2022, prices had decreased slightly but still remained at high levels. Further, because Russia and Ukraine are major producers and exporters of crops, the Russia/Ukraine war has led to a crop supply reduction, which subsequently created a need for higher yields in other countries and drove up crop protection prices. However, the Russia/Ukraine war appears to have had a very limited impact on volumes in the Crop Science market as both countries accounted for less than 5% of the total market value for 2022 (Roland Berger Report). Driven by the foregoing trends, the underlying Crop Science market is expected to experience long-term growth of approximately 2% CAGR until 2027, ultimately reaching approximately €77 billion (Roland Berger Report). Source: AgbioInvestor; Roland Berger Report

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: _General_ The Crop Science CDMO market, which is the key addressable market relevant to CABB, is expected to grow faster than the general Crop Science market. Crop Science CDMO players serve as an outsourcing solution for global Crop Science companies versus the in-house development and manufacturing of crop protection products. The decision of Crop Science players to outsource to CDMO specialists is mainly driven by three factors: (1) technical expertise; (2) capacity availability; and (3) cost considerations and capital expenditure requirements (Roland Berger Report), which are further detailed below under “—Key Drivers.” Over the years, there has been an increase in outsourcing within the Crop Science industry. As of 2022, approximately 40-50% of active ingredient production by Crop Science players was outsourced to contract manufacturers, such as CABB. The CDMO Crop Science market represented about €6.5-7.0 billion as of 2022, having grown at a CAGR of 9-10% between 2019 and 2022. The market is expected to further grow at a CAGR of 4-5% until 2027 (Roland Berger Report). Due to the increasing complexity of new molecules, a lack of available capacities in-house at clients and a high likelihood of customers engaging in cost reduction efforts, it is expected that Crop Science players will outsource an increasing share of development and manufacturing to CDMOs (Roland Berger Report). 92 ----- _Key Drivers (1) Technical expertise_ Among the factors considered, technical expertise and know-how is one of the top decision criteria that companies take into consideration when determining whether to outsource their production. This is explained by the rising complexity of new active ingredient molecules. Synthesis of these molecules requires a higher number of steps, so the production process typically requires specialist know-how. Since major Crop Science players may not always have the complete technical expertise required, they increasingly rely on CDMO partners with an increasing share of their production process expected to be outsourced in the future as a result (Roland Berger Report). _(2) Capacity availability_ Another important key decision criterion for customers when choosing their CDMO partner is suitable capacity availability. Crop Science players do not always have excess capacity to cover growing product demand and consequently rely increasingly on CDMO partners. As major Crop Science players look to outsource their production activities, the ability for CDMOs to offer sufficient fit-for-purpose production capacity as well as flexibility for further expansion is critical (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). _(3) Cost considerations and capex requirements_ The increasing complexity of molecules, more stringent regulatory trends and fast-evolving customer demand patterns mean that major Crop Science players must focus increasingly on research and development, regulatory and marketing activities, and thereby less on growing in-house manufacturing. Against this backdrop, Crop Science players are focused on ensuring cost and capex discipline with regard to production activities, which supports their decision to outsource production to CDMOs (Roland Berger Report). _CDMO Globally_ The CDMO market is expected to grow by a CAGR of 4-5% across geographies, with India as key growth driver and decent growth in Europe at a CAGR of 2-4%, given the different growth dynamics in various locations. Below is a list of geographies in terms of the location of production for the CDMO market. On a regional level, Europe accounted for 20-25% of market value in 2022 and is expected to grow at a CAGR of 2-4% until 2027, primarily driven by the introduction of and increasing demand for new proprietary and complex active ingredients. Europe is home to three of the global Crop Science majors and a strong foothold in the region ensures customer proximity. India is the largest market, accounting for approximately 35-40% of the global Crop Science CDMO market. While outsourcing to China has grown substantially over the last decade, increasing competition from India and concerns over security of supply are expected to limit growth going forward. India is the key historic and future growth driver and is expected to capture a large part of the additionally outsourced production due to strong customer relationships with major customers, high price competitiveness paired with less governmental control compared to China and increasing manufacturing competence. Consequently, India’s Crop Science CDMO market is expected to grow at 8-10% CAGR until 2027, compared to a 15-16% growth rate from 2019 to 2022. North America and Japan, respectively, represent 3-8% and 2-4% of the global CDMO market and are expected to grow at a CAGR of 5-7% and 1-3%, compared to 4-5% growth each from 2019 to 2022. The North American market is expected to benefit from, among other things, higher level of regulation and high energy prices in Europe. However, Europe and North America still remain important markets as shown in the graphic below (Roland Berger Report). 93 ----- Source: AgbioInvestor; Roland Berger Report

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: Key competitors (by turnover) in the European Crop Science CDMO space include: Saltigo (Germany), Arxada (Switzerland), WeylChem Group (Germany) and ESIM (Austria). Further, there are several Asian players including Deccan (India) and Lianhetech (China) and in North America, CABB’s Jayhawk site competes with Viakem (Mexico) and Grace (US). (Roland Berger Report). Saltigo and CABB are the key European players in the novel active ingredients (AIs) segment. Further, along with Saltigo, CABB is one of the leading players in the Crop Science market in terms of technological know-how, possessing the ability to meet customer demands on a variety of commercial levels. Further, CABB has a strong track record and long-standing client relationships due to its strong customer centricity. CABB has a unique global supply chain structure with CDMO sites in the U.S., Switzerland and Finland. Proximity to the headquarters of key Crop Science players such as Syngenta, Bayer and BASF in Europe and Corteva and FMC in the U.S. constitute an advantage for CABB in the competitive landscape. Certain players in Asia perform better from a price perspective due to lower personnel and infrastructure costs and fewer regulatory requirements. However, price is less important for purchase decisions, as customers typically focus on technical know-how and track record first (Roland Berger Report). The Crop Science CDMO market shows a broad range of growth rates depending on the year of introduction of the respective products. Products introduced after 2010 (“Novel AIs”) experience a higher outsourcing share and are expected to exhibit stronger growth of 10% CAGR or above from 2022 until 2027. Those Novel AIs introduced after 2010 account for approximately 5-10% of the addressable 2022 Crop Science CDMO market. The majority of the market value of products launched before 1990 comprises generic active ingredients (>50%) with an established market position but also lower expected growth from 2022 to 2027 of approximately 2-3% CAGR (Roland Berger Report). As of 2021, CABB, Deccan, Lianhetech, Saltigo, and PI Industries combined accounted for approximately 3237% of the global Crop Science CDMO Market. Together with the remaining five top ten competitors, the top ten players account for approximately 50-55% of the overall Crop Science CDMO market (Roland Berger Report). In terms of the market share in the EU, the Crop Science CDMO market is concentrated, with the top five players in total comprising an estimated market share of 70-75% in 2021. More specifically, Saltigo represented 23-28% of the market share, CABB 17-22%, Arxada 8-13%, WeylChem 6-11%, ESIM 5-10% and other entities combined 24-29% of the overall market (Roland Berger Report). 94 -----

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: The Life Science industry involves companies working in areas such as personal care, nutrition and pharmaceuticals. Within the Life Science market, CABB mainly manufactures four products: (1) monochloroacetic acid (“MCA”), which is predominantly used in personal care, e.g., bath and shower products, but also in other items outside of the Life Sciences industry; (2) dichloroacetic acid (“DCA”) used in pharmaceuticals, e.g., novel RNA and DNA therapeutics; (3) glycolic acid (“GA”), which is used in personal care, e.g., skin care, and other products outside of the Life Sciences industry; and (4) ethyl-2-chloroacetoacetate (“CAE”), which is used in food and feed, e.g., vitamins, and other products outside of the Life Sciences industry (Roland Berger Report).

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: Demand for Life Science ingredients is driven by the underlying demand for Life Science products, which in turn is primarily impacted by several structural long-term trends: (1) as the global population ages, chronic diseases and spending on pharmaceutical products are expected to rise. This is also fueled by a growing middle class leading an increasingly sedentary lifestyle; (2) the growing middle class has resulted in corresponding growth in disposable income and an expected increase in spending per capita on personal care products, especially antiaging solutions; (3) ongoing innovations and technological progress are enabling new therapeutic approaches and more customized and personalized medicine that require Life Science ingredients; (4) rising prosperity in emerging economies and rapid urbanization has corresponded with improved access to medical treatment and solutions; and (5) rising concerns about the harmful effects of chemicals and synthetic products is shifting consumer preference towards organic products, which may in turn decrease demand for chemical intermediates in personal care and nutrition. Some consumers are also increasingly concerned about negative effects chemicals may have on the environment (Roland Berger Report).

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: _General_ MCA is a building block in organic synthesis used in Life Sciences not only for the production of ingredients for personal care, pharma and food products but also for industrial applications. As of 2022, the total global MCA market represented about 1,100-1,200 ktons. Our MCA is mainly used in the Life Science industry, the Crop Science industry and in Industrials & others. Life Science represented the largest MCA end-market as of 2022, accounting for approximately 40-50% of the market volume. MCA has a large market volume of 520-540 ktons focused on Life Science as of 2022, with a solid growth outlook of 4-5% CAGR (in terms of volumes in ktons) between 2022 and 2027. In 2022, CABB was one of the largest MCA producer in terms of production capacity installed. CABB and Nouryon are considered the leading market players in terms of security of supply and delivering quality and high purity MCA (Roland Berger Report). Other key competitors in this space include PCC Rokita SA (Poland) and Niacet (U.S.). In terms of supply security, we and Nouryon are known to offer highly reliable supplies and are located in key geographic areas in close proximity to key customers (Roland Berger Report). _Key Drivers_ As of 2022, MCA within the Life Science market was expected to grow at a CAGR of 4-5% (in terms of volumes in ktons) between 2022 and 2027, primarily due to the increased focus on hygiene and general health awareness. This is driven by, among others, the following factors: (1) a higher demand for personal care products and detergents supported by COVID-19, which is expected to positively impact the demand for MCA and betaines (partially made up of MCA) in the long-run since they are essential ingredients in producing these personal care products; (2) within consumer products in emerging markets, an increasing switch from solid to liquid products, including soap and dishwashing detergents, which is expected to have a positive volume impact on betaines since they are frequently used in liquid personal care products; and (3) within the food industry, an increasing trend of adding carboxymethyl cellulose (CMC) as a thickening agent or stabilizer in different foods and beverages. As CMC production requires MCA as ingredient, MCA demand is expected to correspondingly benefit. While volumes are expected to grow moderately overall, driven by the aforementioned market-trends, prices are expected to decline after a peak in 2022 because MCA price is strongly linked to commoditized raw material prices, and input costs are typically passed through to customers (Roland Berger Report). 95 ----- Source: Roland Berger Report _MCA Esters_ As of 2022, the global Life Science MMCA and EMCA markets are expected to grow in value by around 4-5% CAGR between 2024 and 2027, following a period of moderate growth or stagnation from 2023 to 2024 and a decline in 2023 due to normalization of energy prices. The underlying volume growth can largely be attributed to growing demand from all end-markets, i.e., food supplements (vitamin A), pharma (contrast agents and piracetam) and the flavor and fragrances industry (Roland Berger Report). We convert MCA to MCA esters, i.e. methylmonochloroacetate (MMCA) and ethylmonochloroacetate (EMCA), with applications such as producing contrast agents, vitamins and other drugs such as the anti-dementia drug Piracetam.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: _General_ DCA is a chemical compound predominantly used as a crucial component in the oligonucleotide synthesis process for next-gen RNA-based therapeutics in pharmaceuticals. It is an essential ingredient in the key process step (detritylation) of siRNA through oligonucleotide synthesis and for the chemical synthesis of DNA templates used to produce mRNA drugs. DCA is the ideal reagent in this process given its purity, acid strength and ease of use. The end-use applications of oligonucleotide-based drugs are in genetic diseases and next-gen cancer treatments (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). Historically, DCA experienced a growth of more than 100% CAGR between 2019 and 2022. DCA is a niche market with €15-20 million in market value as of 2022, and with an estimated market value CAGR of 20% to 65% between 2022 and 2027 (depending upon underlying assumptions, specifically on the performance of the key commercial product on the market). Overall, the pure DCA market is expected to outgrow the underlying market for oligonucleotide-based drugs, as DCA is a main component of blockbuster products as well as other promising drugs in the research and development pipeline. In a conservative case, the DCA market is expected to grow at a CAGR of approximately 20-30% until 2027, assuming limited contributions from the key commercial product and new blockbuster drugs as well as some price decline. In an optimistic case, assuming key product sales grow according to global data forecasts, non-blockbuster product sales develop in line with the oligonucleotide synthesis market (approximately 15% CAGR), and that the blockbuster drugs currently reach commercial launch, the DCA market could grow at a CAGR of up to 60-70%, in a scenario that assumes no price decline (Roland Berger Report). 96 ----- Key competitors in this space include Hongene, a Chinese DCA producer with limited footprint in Europe and other Chinese players that produce DCA but focus on lower purity products. Due to the complexity of producing high purity DCA, other Chinese players besides Hongene are predominantly focused on a lower quality and lower purity level of production than CABB. As a result, European and U.S. distributors typically do not partner with other Chinese manufacturers apart from Hongene due to current quality & purity profiles as of 2022 (Roland Berger Report). _Key Drivers_ The underlying oligonucleotide synthesis market is expected to grow significantly, primarily driven by research and development investments and innovations. Specifically, growth in the oligonucleotide synthesis market is expected to be driven by (1) increased government funding and research efforts to improve genomic technologies (e.g., DNA sequencing) and develop oligonucleotide-based drugs, as well as growing demand for synthesized oligos for use in several pharmaceutical companies’ pipeline drugs; and (2) a broadening field of applications stemming from technical advancements that are expected to further increase importance of oligonucleotide-based drugs (Roland Berger Report). The DCA market is expected to outgrow the oligonucleotide synthesis market, as it is a key input of already marketed and potentially upcoming “blockbuster” drugs (Roland Berger Report). Key drivers include: (1) CDMOs increasing production capacity to meet growing demand from customers along with expected increases in endmarket demand for existing oligonucleotide-based drugs as they receive approvals from regulatory bodies and reimbursement is improved; and (2) ongoing innovation in connection to oligonucleotide-based drugs leading to the discovery of new treatments requiring DCA as raw material for their synthesis in addition to ongoing investigation into DCA given directly as a treatment (e.g., as possible treatment for endometriosis) that will likely lead to new areas of application and increase demand (Roland Berger Report).

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: _General_ GA with ultra-high purity profiles is primarily used in skin care for various lotions and peeling products (e.g., anti-aging creams, facial cleansers, etc.). In 2022, GA had a market value of €50-60 million with a moderate expected growth outlook of 3-6% CAGR between 2022 and 2027. Skin care was the largest application of GA, accounting for around 55-65% of the overall market in 2022 and is expected to grow at a market value CAGR of 3-6% CAGR from 2022-2027. Key competitors in this space included Chemours (US), CrossChem (US) and a number of Chinese and Indian players focused on the lower end of the quality spectrum. Chemours is the only player that manufactures products of similar quality to those of CABB (Roland Berger Report). _Key Drivers_ Overall, the glycolic acid market is expected to experience moderate growth until 2027, driven by usage in personal care products, growing by 3-4% CAGR from 2022-2025 and 4-6% CAGR from 2025 to 2027. The key drivers include: (1) rising adoption of skin care products utilizing GA as ingredient (e.g., anti-aging products) due to its superior properties related to water holding capacity, skin hydration and skin turgor/acne removal, for which no organic substitutes have been identified as of today; (2) growing importance of personal appearance and related beauty products, especially in emerging markets; many products containing glycolic acid, such as moisturizers, cleansers, acne treatment and skin lightening treatments, are in high demand; and (3) new care product developments of (large) personal care brand owners/product manufacturers as GA remains one of the key ingredients, especially for removal of old skin particles and skin moisturizing (Roland Berger Report).

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: _General_ CAE is typically a by-product from, e.g., chlorination processes and serves as a building block that can be used in a variety of rather niche synthesis steps and has various applications. Vitamin production using CAE (CMO process) is located in Europe while players in APAC typically use the EMO process. In the pharmaceutical sector, CAE is used as a building block for APIs, e.g., in Cimetidine for treating GERD (Gastroesophageal reflux disease) and in other molecules used to treat diseases of the central nervous system and cardiovascular system. CAE is valued for its reactiveness and the high yields it produces (Roland Berger Report). 97 ----- The non-captive CAE market remains a niche market in Life Sciences with a market value of €15-20 million as of 2022 and an expected growth outlook of 3-4% CAGR between 2022 and 2027 (Roland Berger Report). It is estimated that 50-60% of the companies that require CAE produce it in-house. CAE is typically created as a by-product of other production processes, such as chlorination. As of 2022, the expected growth projection for CAE used in vitamins was a market value CAGR of 3-4% until 2027. Key competitors in this space include Wacker Chemie AG (or Wacker) (Germany) and certain Asian players, such as Sinochem (China). In terms of the end-customers’ key purchasing criteria, including customer relationships and price, there were small differences between the major market players CABB and Wacker, and both were clearly ahead of Asian competition by all metrics except pricing. CABB is focused on the high purity segment in which delivery reliability and price are the most important purchasing criteria (Roland Berger Report). _Key Drivers_ As stated above, as of 2022, the expected growth projection for CAE used as the building blocks for vitamins is 3-4% CAGR until 2027, primarily driven by the following factors: (1) rapidly developing personalized and functional nutrition as consumer and societal expectations are set to move beyond taste and texture and awareness of the importance of a quality nutritional profile grows. Vitamins can improve the nutritional value of both meat and dairy alternatives. Demand is also being driven by (2) the increasing use of feed fortification since farm animals remain an important part of the nutrition of a growing global population. Feed fortification through the addition of vitamins can improve the lifetime performance of farm animals through benefits related to animal health and digestion by extracting more value from the feed. Lastly, (3) a growing incidence of vitamin deficiency observed in patients with certain diseases and an increased prevalence of these diseases is expected to augment market growth for certain vitamins such as vitamin B6 to address autoimmune, kidney and liver diseases (Roland Berger Report).

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: _General_ Within the Performance Materials market, we supply specialty anhydrides (including benzophenone tetracarboxylic-dianhydride (BTDA), hexafluoroispropylidene diphthalic anhydride (6FDA) and electronic performance materials (one product) to our customers. BTDA and 6FDA are used in the electronics, infrastructure and transportation sub-markets and, more specifically, can be used as a co-monomer for preparation of polyimide thin films used within electrical insulation and hot-gas filtration. The Electronic Performance Materials Product are used in semi-conductors and in the laboratory space for diagnostic purposes (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). As of 2022, specialty anhydrides represented a global value of €180-200 million. BTDA and 6FDA constitute a significant share of the specialty anhydrides market. All specialty anhydrides are high-value products that are supplied into niche markets. The BTDA market is expected to grow from €25-35 million market value at a CAGR of 3-5% until 2027 and the 6FDA market is expected to grow from €30-40 million market value at 7-8% CAGR until 2027 (Roland Berger Report). _Key Drivers_ The specialty anhydrides market is expected to continue growth from 2022 to 2027. Such growth is driven by higher demand from all end markets, especially the electronics end-market due to the following drivers: (1) growing volumes of newly purchased smart devices like phones and tablet computers, which in turn drive demand for BTDA-based polyimide films used for electrical insulation in smart devices; (2) the expected global switch to 5G infrastructure will likely also drive the increased demand for dianhydrides like BTDA and 6FDA which are used for polyimide-based flexible films in 5G circuitry; (3) the bioprocessing market is growing dynamically, and thus so is 6FDA which is used for hollow fiber membranes within the single-use equipment for chemical separation in highly acidic environments that is gaining share over previously used stainless steel equipment; (4) the superior properties of polyimide fibers that make them an appealing material in hot-gas filtration, e.g., in waste incineration and cement production, which is expected to experience high single-digit growth, driven by more stringent environmental regulation, standards for flue gas filtration and CO2 reduction requirements; and (5) growth within the transportation industry is expected to lead to increased demand for dianhydrides, as they are used for the thermal insulation of aircraft engines and marine vessels. Although the relevant aerospace market declined due to the COVID-19 pandemic, continuous recovery is expected until 2027 (Roland Berger Report). 98 -----

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: _General_ One of CABB’s products in Performance Materials which is exclusively manufactured for one customer (the “Electronic Performance Materials Product”) is used in semiconductor production as well as in laboratory and diagnostics applications. As of 2022, the addressable market for the Electronic Performance Materials Product had a market value of around approximately €80-100 million. The vast majority of this market value is represented by application in the semiconductor industry where the Electronic Performance Materials Product is used as a plating and surface treatment agent before the chemical vapor deposition process. The remaining portion of the addressable market for the Electronic Performance Materials Product is represented by applications in the laboratory and diagnostics space, where they are used for the calibration of nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy of organic solvents. Overall, the addressable market for the Electronic Performance Materials Product is expected to benefit from a growing demand for semiconductors and NMR spectroscopy (Roland Berger Report). _Key Drivers_ As of 2022, the addressable market for the Electronic Performance Materials Product is expected to experience strong growth of 8-10% CAGR until 2027, driven by the growing demand in the semiconductor industry and increased use of NMR spectroscopy due to the following key factors: (1) demand for consumer electronics such as mobile communication devices and smart watches is increasing alongside a global rise in household income 99 ----- with semiconductors being an integral part of consumer electronics; (2) electrification and growing digital solutions within the automotive industry are expected to contribute to an increased demand for the Electronic Performance Materials Product, driven by trends in autonomous driving technology such as driver assistance tools and digital connectivity; (3) the rise of artificial intelligence applications in various products requiring strong computational power for data processing, leading to an increasing demand for powerful semiconductor-enabled hardware; (4) increasing digital connectivity driven by the Internet of Things and 5G expansion will drive semiconductor demand; and (5) increasing research and development activities in the area of pharmaceuticals, biotechnology, agriculture, and nutrition which in turn increase the necessity of molecule identification and structure and composition analysis with the aid of NMR spectroscopy requiring the Electronic Performance Materials Product in the calibration of organic solvents (Roland Berger Report).

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsection Title: Addressable market for the Electronic Performance Materials Product by application, 2019-2027 (€m)
Subsubsection Text: We also provide sodium hydroxide (caustic soda) in our sites in Gersthofen and Pratteln and are the only producer in Switzerland offering logistic advantages. Caustic soda is used in production of various intermediate products as well as a wide range of end applications such as in chemicals, pulp and paper, and alumina, among others. For example, it is used in the base feedstock for the production of various chemicals as well as in the pulping of wood for paper production or regenerated fibers. Sodium hydroxide is also used in the water treatment process. The volume demand for sodium hydroxide is therefore closely related to GDP development (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). Sodium hydroxide is a by-product of chlorine production. This allows chlorine producers to recycle the chlorine they produce and monetize it. As it is highly commoditized, the supply chains of sodium hydroxide are relatively short and as a result, our target market for sodium hydroxide remains mainly in Europe (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). Overall, the sodium hydroxide market is expected to experience positive volume growth from 2022 to 2027, and is used in numerous end-markets, such as automotive, textile, pulp and paper and household cleaners. The price of sodium hydroxide, on the other hand, is historically volatile and difficult to predict due to its dependency on chlorine production and energy prices. Key indicators point towards a slight decline in 2023 and subsequent years, though price is expected to remain above 2021 levels. For example, PVC consumption, which is the main driver of the supply of caustic soda, is expected to grow by approximately 1% or less until 2026. Electricity price, which is a driver of production cost, started to drop towards the end of 2022 and is expected to drop further in 2024, though it is expected to remain higher than pre-COVID-19. Specifically, pricing of caustic soda reached an alltime high in 2022 with a yearly average of €765/t (WE spot rate), compared to a five-year average of €402/t for 2017-2022 and an average of €260/t for 2020-2021. Caustic soda prices are expected to decrease to the level of €550-700/t in 2023, and then normalize at a longer-term average of €400-600/t from 2024 onwards (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). 100 -----
