Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: We are a leading CDMO (contract development and manufacturing organization) and fine chemistry manufacturer with global operations, supplying customized ingredients to major players in the Western Crop Science market, as well as high purity and high-complexity chemical ingredients to customers in the Life Science and Performance Material markets. Our strong technology portfolio, technical know-how and execution capabilities allow us to cover a wide spectrum of highly specialized customer needs, specifications and complexity profiles. Headquartered in Germany, we operate a global network with six production facilities located in Pratteln (Switzerland), Kokkola (Finland), Galena (Kansas, United States), Gersthofen (Germany), Knapsack (Germany) and Jining, Shandong Province (China). Our varied product portfolio is organized across two product groups: (i) Exclusives (tailor-made active ingredients and precursors developed for individual customers on an exclusive basis (our CDMO offering)) and Specialties (highly specialized ingredients with applications in high-margin end-markets) products and (ii) Advanced Intermediates and Base Chemicals products (intermediate and base chemical products such as high purity monochloroacetic acid (“MCA”), chloroacetyl chloride (“CAC1”) and caustic soda across a large purity spectrum with multiple end-use applications). Our products are deeply embedded into our customers’ value chains, often on a near-exclusive basis, allowing us to be aligned in demand planning and supply chain coordination and to set up scalable manufacturing facilities and efficient commercial production processes. The combination of our production know-how, lengthy product development processes and contractually agreed capital expenditure contributions for some of our products typically result in high contract renewal rates and low customer churn. For the financial year ended December 31, 2022, we generated revenue of €755.5 million and an Adjusted EBITDA of €162.6 million (21.5% Adjusted EBITDA margin). Between 2020 and 2022, our revenue grew at 23.9% CAGR, whereas our Adjusted EBITDA grew at 20.0% CAGR. Exclusives and Specialties contributed to 56.8% of our revenue for the financial year ended December 31, 2022 whereas Advanced Intermediates and Base Chemicals accounted for 43.2% of our revenue for the same period. Our products are used for end-market applications mainly in: (i) Crop Science (e.g., herbicides, fungicides, insecticides and other livestock and crop protection products), (ii) Life Science (e.g., pharma, personal care, nutrition, fragrances and flavor applications) and (iii) Performance Materials (e.g., curatives in epoxies, polyimides, polyesters and other resin systems used for electronic components, semiconductors and for composites, fibers, films, and foams that provide heat and electrical resistance). These end-markets, in particular Crop Science, have shown resilient historical growth rates and benefit from structural mega-trends that are expected to drive further resilient growth in the near- to mid-term, such as increasing demand for food and need for increased farming yields on the one hand, and an aging population and improving living standards on the other. In 2022, based on internal assessments, we estimate that approximately 50% of our products were used in the Crop Science market, approximately 20% in the Life Science market, approximately 15% in the Performance Materials market and approximately 15% relate to others (e.g., base chemicals and industrial MCA) (measured as a percentage of revenues). Exclusives, our CDMO offering, provides tailor-made active ingredients and precursors tailored to individual customer specifications in Crop Science and are a primary contributor to our overall profitability. Based on customer-developed IP, these products require customized production lines, expansive know-how and close cooperation with our customers. We offer development and manufacturing services for proprietary products on an exclusive and confidential basis to leading players in the Crop Science market such as: BASF, Bayer, Corteva and Syngenta, and we have relationships with nearly all major players in the Western Crop Science market. Our Specialties offering consists of specialty ingredients that leverage our considerable manufacturing expertise to create complex chemical products that serve specific customer needs across a variety of applications in the Crop Science, Life Science and Performance Materials industries. Unlike Exclusives, these products can be offered to multiple customers at a time. Our offering highlights our excellent production capabilities and knowhow along with our ability to offer specialized technology process and development services which allows us to continuously provide high-quality and purity products to our customers and which we believe is a key differentiator in this field. Our Specialties products are also a strong contributor to profitability, leveraging our close client relationship and high customer “stickiness”. In particular, we offer high value-add products for fast 101 ----- growing applications in Life Science (pharma and personal care as well as nutrition) and Performance Materials markets (coatings, e.g., in electronics or other industrial applications), backed by several attractive long-term customer contracts, which offer high visibility on the lifecycle and returns on our products. Customers for our Specialties products include players such as Agilent Technologies, Bayer, Corteva, Deciem/Estee Lauder, DSM, Evonik, Merck, Novartis and Syngenta. In our Advanced Intermediates and Base Chemicals product group, we offer intermediate and base chemical products, such as MCA, CAC1 and caustic soda, that serve as chemical building blocks for other secondary chemical processes with a variety of applications across a large number of industries and markets. We believe we are one of the leading suppliers of MCA to Western Europe and the Americas and we operate state-of-the-art sites, allowing us to provide a full range of purity and quality for our customers. Large parts of our Advanced Intermediates supply agreements feature price formulas that allow us to partially pass on price increases in costs of certain raw materials. Furthermore, we also generate a portion of our revenue from Base Chemicals and other products such as caustic soda, that are generated as by-products from our Exclusives and Advanced Intermediates production lines.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Structurally growing end-markets and increasing outsourcing trends
Subsubsection Text: Our underlying key end-markets (Crop Science, Life Science and Performance Materials) are enjoying strong and resilient underlying growth, further supported by increasing outsourcing trends that are reinforcing demand for our Crop Science CDMO offering. In the financial year ended December 31, 2022, approximately 70% of our revenue was generated in the Crop Science and Life Science markets (estimate based on internal company assessments), the majority of which consists of our CDMO offering through our Exclusives products and to a smaller degree of contributions from our Advanced Intermediates and Base Chemicals products. As a result, growth in the underlying Crop Science and Life Science markets, specifically within CDMO products and novel advanced intermediates, represent key growth levers for our business. _Crop Science_ Our addressable CDMO Crop Science market grew by 9% to 10% CAGR between 2019 and 2022, outperforming the underlying global market for Crop Science products which grew by approximately 8% CAGR during the same period (Roland Berger Report, AgbioInvestor). Market research indicates continued growth until 2027 with respect to both our addressable CDMO Crop Science market (4% to 5% CAGR from 2022 to 2027) and the underlying global market for Crop Science products (2% CAGR) (Roland Berger Report, AgbioInvestor). For more information on the specific historical and projected growth of the addressable CDMO Crop Science and underlying global Crop Science markets, see “Industry and Market Data⸺Crop Science⸺General.” The growth in the underlying global Crop Science market in particular is underpinned by the following megatrends (see “Industry and Market Data⸺Crop Science⸺Key Drivers” for a more detailed overview) (Roland Berger Report, AgbioInvestor): - Growing population: global population growth drives demand for food and crops; and - Decreasing arable land: arable land per capita is decreasing, requiring efficient crop protection products to increase farming yields. These market dynamics are further supported by several specific trends in the addressable CDMO Crop Science market, including (see “Industry and Market Data⸺Crop Science⸺Key Drivers” for a more detailed overview) (Roland Berger Report, AgbioInvestor, Company Information): - Growth in CDMO outsourcing: customers prioritizing research and development, sales and marketing and digitalization activities and striving to reduce their capital intensity and costs (in 2022, approximately 40% to 50% of active ingredient production by Crop Science Players was outsourced to CDMOs); - Increasing complexity of active ingredient molecules: requires specialist CDMO partners with strong technical expertise and assets fitting into global supply chains of Crop Science players; and - Increasingly stringent regulatory requirements: lead to higher demand for novel active ingredients, often outsourced to CDMOs with highly efficient multi-purpose facilities. 102 ----- Furthermore, historical demand for crop protection products has proven to be resilient to adverse events maintaining a growth trend in spite of temporary downturns. For example, declines in average crop commodity prices (e.g., corn, wheat, soybean) caused by events such as lower pest pressure and economic recessions in production markets such as in Brazil, and North American weather conditions in 2019 led to a temporary downturn in the crop protection market but were followed by year-on-year increases. Furthermore, while agrochemical production was impacted by coronavirus-related restrictions in the first quarter of 2020, it swiftly normalized following an easing of lockdown restrictions. While the coronavirus restrictions did impact labor availability both in terms of production and field work, many countries deemed the agricultural sector to be of considerable importance in maintaining food security, so restrictions on movement were less severe than in most industries (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). The addressable market for novel active ingredients (active ingredients introduced after 2010), a subset of the CDMO Crop Science market, is anticipating significantly higher growth rates at a CAGR of approximately 13.7% from 2021 to 2027, owing to, among other factors, a higher outsourcing rate due to production complexity (Roland Berger Report). Against this background, we act as a key partner for our clients in this area, supporting innovators with our technical expertise and state-of-the-art production facilities. Our Crop Science product portfolio benefits from a modern set of active ingredients. We are not materially involved in the production of raw materials or finished product for glyphosate or neonicotinoids. _Life Science_ Our Specialty products benefit from the strong underlying growth rates in a number of attractive niche markets for specialized Life Science applications. In 2022, the addressable Life Science market accounted for the second largest portion of our revenue after the Crop Science market. Our products in this area consist primarily of Advanced Intermediates products as well as Specialties products. Our addressable Life Science markets grew between 2019 and 2022 and are expected to grow further, driven by structural mega-trends including a global aging population and an increasing disposable income spent on personal care, showing the strength of this segment for our future growth potential (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). For more information on trends driving Life Sciences growth (including niche markets), see “Industry and Market Data⸺Life Science⸺Key Drivers.” Individual addressable high growth sub-markets such as the oligonucleotide synthesis market (used for the production of synthetic RNA and DNA templates) increased significantly in 2021 and 2022, and forecasts are estimating future significant growth. See also “Industry and Market Data⸺Life Science⸺General⸺DCA.” While this is in part due to the market’s limited current size, it also highlights how we may be able to leverage our technical excellence to capitalize on developing demand for high-purity ingredients. For example, we are the global market leader and only large-scale Western supplier of high purity grade DCA (a key ingredient for RNAbased medication) in Life Science for pharmaceutical applications (by high purity DCA revenue as of 2022). Furthermore, DCA applications in the production of synthetic RNA and DNA templates have wider uses in the Life Sciences industry than COVID-19 applications (where mostly enzymatic synthesis is employed), so our product has only some commercial exposure to the trends driving COVID-19 vaccines and will benefit from growing end markets due to both increased investments into research and development (e.g. improvement of genomic technologies) as well as broader commercial use (e.g. “oligonucleotide therapeutics”), see “Industry and _Market Data⸺Life Science⸺DCA⸺Key Drivers” (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). Performance Materials_ Our Specialties products with niche applications benefit from attractive market dynamics in addressable endmarkets in the Performance Materials segment, BTDA, 6FDA and other markets, which are expected to grow until 2027 (Roland Berger Report). For more information on projected growth rates, see “Industry and Market _Data⸺Performance Materials⸺Specialty Anhydrides⸺General and “Industry and Market Data⸺Performance Materials⸺Electronic Performance Materials Product⸺General.”_ Our BTDA and 6FDA products are used for numerous applications in electronics, infrastructure and transportation and benefit from favorable macro trends in these sectors, such as growth in smart devices, the switch to 5G infrastructure and higher government and industry spending on infrastructure. Our electronic performance materials product is primarily used in the semiconductor industry, which fundamentally benefits from (i) the introduction of new generation semiconductors, (ii) increasing electrification (e.g., autonomous driving and digital connectivity) and (iii) the rise of artificial intelligence enabled by semiconductors (Roland Berger Report). 103 -----

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Leading Crop Science CDMO and Differentiated Life Science Ingredients Player with Global Presence
Subsubsection Text: We are a leading player in the Western Crop Science CDMO market, serving major global agrochemicals companies and holding strategic supplier status with some of the largest European-based Crop Science companies for their agrochemicals business. We are among the top two Western CDMO players in the Crop Science market (by Crop Science CDMO revenue as of 2021). We have a strong focus on novel active ingredients, directly competing with only a select number of other Tier 1 players that are able to serve this segment. We are wellpositioned within the top five players globally in the Crop Science market (measured by Crop Science CDMO revenue as of 2021) due to strong customer relationships, diverse and unique asset footprint and technical knowhow (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). We also have a significant presence in the Life Science market, providing customized products in segments such as novel RNA therapeutics, vitamins and supplements, and anti-aging and personal care and hold leading positions in the markets for European MCA supply, high purity DCA, as well as CAE manufacturing and cosmetic grade GA in Life Science: We are one of the largest European Life Science MCA suppliers (by production volume in Europe as of 2022). We are the global market leader and only large-scale Western supplier of high purity grade DCA (a key ingredient for RNA-based medication) in Life Science for pharmaceutical applications (by high purity DCA revenue as of 2022) (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). In cosmetic grade GA, we are globally the second largest supplier (measured by revenue as of 2022) and the only European producer with global coverage (Company assessment based on Roland Berger Report). Our customized products are highly integrated in our key customers’ value chains (sometimes protected by “key supplier” relationships for major products), and we are closely aligned in demand planning and coordination. We have flexible multi-purpose contract manufacturing plants that allow for optimized downtimes between different product campaigns and change-overs. Furthermore, we benefit from six well-invested sites across the globe offering reliability, safety and high product quality. As a result, we have developed a strong reputation of reliable performance in delivering innovative products in large quantities to our clients. We also operate a global site network with assets spanning the U.S., Europe and China, which we believe is unique among Tier 1 Crop Science CDMOs.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Longstanding, Trusted Relationships with Diversified, Blue-Chip Customer Base
Subsubsection Text: We have long-standing relationships with most of our blue-chip customers. We are a trusted partner to major players in the Crop Science market and numerous leading specialties companies in the Life Science and Performance Materials markets rely on our solutions and significant expertise for their products and applications. High customer retention rates serve as a competitive moat against new entrants: For example, in 2021 and 2022, we had an overall average customer retention rate of approximately 98% (based on existing customer revenue over total revenue for the respective year), which illustrates, together with the high rate of contract renewal and lock-in effects, the “stickiness” of our topline in Exclusives. Our average duration of business relationships with our top four customers in Crop Science exceeds 15 years in tenure (based on management estimates between 2020 and 2022) and a number of our Crop Science blue-chip relationships span more than 30 years (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). Together with the high revenue visibility that most of our longer-term contracts in Exclusives provide, our customers’ long-term commitments are supported by a track record of co-investments in production facilities through upfront capital expenditure or top-up pricing over the term of the contract. We supply a multitude of individual products to our top customers, which we believe indicates our customers’ trust in our capabilities and the quality of our varied products. In 2021 and 2022, we supplied more than 10 products for each of our top three customers. Our customer base in particular reflects our established position and depth of integration into their respective value chains, with the top ten customers by revenue across all markets accounting for approximately 60%, based on internal assessments, of our group-wide revenue in the financial year ended December 31, 2022. Our established customer base in our CDMO Crop Science business includes the top five Crop Science majors across all major crop systems in our key end-markets, with whom we work in close cooperation in terms of process development and planning as well as the lifecycle of the project (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). In addition, while agrochemicals are a key end-market for our products, we are diversifying into other applications such as further high-value intermediates within Advanced Intermediates, pharmaceuticals and Specialties. For our Exclusives products in particular, the close customer cooperation enables de-risked investments in growth capex for further capacity and technology expansion through customer contributions (e.g., capex co-investment or ‘takeor-pay’ commitments by customers). 104 ----- Over the last three years, we have established a track record of consistent project wins (at least one major 1[st] campaign project per year), building upon our deep integration into our customers’ value chains and our reputation of reliability and ability to manage complex processes. As of March 31, 2023, we also had multiple projects in varying ramp-up phases, supporting growth of the business. The growth capex associated with these ramp-up projects mainly targets or has targeted capacity expansion for Exclusives and Specialties across our plants, and production under these projects is expected to ramp-up over the short-term.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Attractive CDMO business model: high visibility, de-risked growth and recurring earnings
Subsubsection Text: For our Exclusives products, we have developed strategic partnerships with well-known companies, including some of the largest global agrochemicals producers, including blue chip customers in our key end-markets. Due to our high level of integration into our customers’ product development and long contract terms for most of our contracts, we have high visibility on the lifecycle and returns on our products. Our long-term contracts often provide for guaranteed volumes in the initial period, contributing to a high contract renewal rate and low customer churn for a large part of our portfolio. Because of our strong market position and customer integration, we also have high visibility into our customers’ future demand and their upcoming product launches. For example, we received customer inquiries from five top Crop Science players for 70% of all active ingredients launched or planned to be launched in the market between 2020 and 2023E (calculated as share of novel active ingredients and advanced/key intermediate launches where we were inquired) and have won projects in novel active ingredients with these players at a success rate of approximately 40% (calculated as the share of projects won if we were inquired). Moreover, our customers in the CDMO business typically contractually agree for new products to either (i) contribute a portion of the capital expenditures related to new product developments and the production line setup, with minimum contract terms providing payback of the capital expenditures incurred directly by us, or (ii) firm take-or-pay agreements with limited capital expenditures contributions upfront. We continue to invest significantly in growth projects to deliver contracted new product wins and in maintenance to safeguard asset reliability. Our disciplined selection criteria in our CDMO business are focused on superior contracts with limited investment periods for growth capex projects where we typically target EBITDA pay-back periods of approximately three years and return rates of approximately 25% IRR secured by binding customer capex or offtake commitments. While this is not achieved in all our projects, we aim to strengthen our product portfolio over time with projects that either match our key criteria or otherwise offer strategic opportunities. We are well positioned to benefit from the ramp-up of contracted growth projects in Kokkola and Pratteln with an existing agreement portfolio featuring ‘take-or-pay’ commitments. For more information, see also “⸺Our _Product Portfolio.”_

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Resilient Top-line Growth and Strong Margins with Significant Future Upside
Subsubsection Text: We have shown our ability to maintain high revenue growth and margin stability, especially within Exclusives and Specialties, driven by new product wins and strong demand in the existing portfolio, while maintaining flexibility to changing market conditions through our ability to partially pass on increasing raw material and energy costs. Most recently, we commissioned a new line of product under a ‘take-or-pay’ contract and secured a new contract in our Exclusives business. Our major project wins over the last four years reflect our consistent track-record of winning and delivering large-scale projects: Source: Company Information (1) Highest annual revenue achieved to date. 105 ----- In addition, our rationalization of our portfolio to focus on high margin and growth products (e.g., DCA, GA for skin care applications) as well as price increases in Advanced Intermediates and Base Chemicals have further contributed to our successful performance. We have also been able to adjust our business to the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic without major impacts on our operations or financial results due to resilient demand from Crop Science and Life Science customers. Driven by our management’s commitment to support high-value products and projects, we have been able to consistently generate stable margins. As a result, our revenue increased at a CAGR of 23.9% from €492.3 million for the financial year ended December 31, 2020 to €755.5 million for the financial year ended December 31, 2022. Revenue growth in 2022 was primarily driven by strong demand in both our product groups across the portfolio supported by higher pricing effects, in particular partial pass-through of increased raw material prices and supply chain costs in our Advanced Intermediates and Base Chemicals product group. Our Adjusted EBITDA has grown at a CAGR of 20.0% from €112.9 million for the financial year ended December 31, 2020 to €162.6 million for the financial year ended December 31, 2022. The significant growth in Adjusted EBITDA in 2022 in particular was due to an increase in pricing resulting in a higher margin for our products from customers in our Exclusives and Specialties business as well as positive pricing effects in our Advanced Intermediates and Base Chemicals business.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Backward-integrated model that enables re-use of by-products and reduction of waste
Subsubsection Text: Increasing operational efficiency is a top priority for us as it provides clear benefits. When these benefits are combined, they create a virtuous cycle by minimizing negative environmental impacts, creating cost advantages in production, driving innovation and enabling our long-term competitiveness. Production processes always result in byproducts. We aim to reuse or commercialize such byproducts wherever feasible and avoid waste wherever possible. To this end, we believe we operate a highly efficient circular economy processes and we eliminate waste by developing highly efficient processes with optimized product yields and reusing materials within production cycles. Besides the environmental and sustainability advantages, this type of closed-loop system also has tangible financial benefits, as it can reduce costs for raw materials and waste treatments. In Pratteln, we are contributing to the creation of a circular economy using a “Verbund System”. This enables highly efficient and sustainable chlorination and sulfonation reactions. Chlorine and sulfur trioxide are produced as primary raw materials and used to manufacture a variety of chlorination and sulfonation reagents. In turn, these are used to produce further downstream intermediates and active ingredients. The HCl and SO2 generated as off-gases are separated, purified and recycled, reused or resold. Finally, our production sites benefit from high supply chain resilience through backward integration of key raw materials and production processes for our Exclusives and Specialties Products (by using our Advanced Intermediates production). In particular, our main multi-purpose plant in Pratteln uses an innovative set-up that offers high efficiency production of Exclusives and Specialties products, based on backwards integration of the key raw materials of chlorine. Together with the supply of large volumes of necessary MCA from our sites in Germany, we can therefore contribute to supply resilience, as we are in control of the relevant production steps and at the same time can manage the direct commercialization of side streams generated in the production processes, which are then sold as Base Chemicals. See “⸺Production Facilities.” We benefit from close proximity to our customers’ main production sites in the Western markets and we focus on developing and maintaining strong logistic capabilities to enable seamless fulfillment and integration in the respective customer’s supply chain. The chart below shows our production site locations around the world and our production capabilities: 106 -----

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Focus on ESG and sustainability principles
Subsubsection Text: We have made ESG one of our corporate priorities and consider it a key element of our success. Due to the nature of our business and our position as a business partner deeply integrated into our customers’ supply chains, we are aware of the importance of ESG in daily operations as our performance directly translates into the value chain and ESG commitments of our partners. We have underlined our sustainability commitment by committing to seven UN sustainable development goals, signing the ‘UN Global Compact’, ‘Charta der Vielfalt’ and the ‘Responsible Care’ initiative. Our corporate programs are based on external standards and assessments, and we have set up a special team as well as an ESG management tool for implementing and monitoring our ESG measures. In 2022, we became a member of the “Together for Sustainability” initiative, a collaboration of operating chemical companies that are committed to sustainability throughout their value chains. From 2022 on, all our sites will undergo annual audits by Eco-Vadis with the latest ratings conducted in 2022. Furthermore, our holistic approach to ESG is reflected by, among other indicators, our twelve sustainability targets, which comprise seven targets by 2025 and five by 2030, respectively, and by the role of ESG performance in management bonus schemes. In addition, we are focused on our social responsibility and, as a result, strive to offer employees an attractive and inspiring work environment that provides opportunities for individual development and growth. We focus on promoting diversity as well as occupational health and safety as essential components for operational excellence. See “Our Business⸺ESG and Sustainability.”

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Focused, Credible Management Team with Proven Track Record
Subsubsection Text: We have a highly qualified workforce alongside an experienced management team with deep industry experience. Our management team has successfully repositioned CABB as an integrated CDMO platform and led a significant step-up in growth and margin since 2018, effectively managing our continued success during the COVID-19 pandemic. Our demonstrated track record has been achieved by strict contract discipline and a streamlined organizational setup, while simultaneously leveraging efficiencies from OneCABB (which combined our legacy business units into one integrated company to flatten the organizational structure and drive efficiencies across functions) and making further improvements to operational excellence. This has been the basis of the successful transformation of our business, developing a differentiated CDMO position with highly successful year-over-year improvements over the past five years, including developing on our environmental, social and governance practices. We believe our management’s industry knowledge and leadership, combined with their long-term experience, provide us with the skills necessary to continue improving performance and efficiency through a common corporate infrastructure and the implementation of best practices across our network, which constitutes a significant competitive advantage and drives our future. On March 24, 2023, we announced that Thomas H. Ahrens will become the new chief executive officer of CABB Group following Valerie Diele-Braun’s departure. Mr. Ahrens will join CABB on June 1, 2023 and succeed 107 ----- Valerie Diele-Braun after a transition period of a few months. We believe Mr. Ahrens to be an experienced leader who has a positive track record in driving sustainable growth and profitability. Building on his extensive industry expertise, we believe he will strengthen the Group’s position as a premier contract development and manufacturing organization and leading producer of proprietary ingredients for customers in the Life Science and Performance Materials industries.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Deliver excellence in production to optimize profitability
Subsubsection Text: We are focused on further developing our project portfolio and aim to add more high-value projects to our portfolio each year, keeping in line with our historical project win rates. Our established market position in Exclusives serves as the backbone of our strategy by continuously driving resilient growth and margin stability, complemented by high growth in existing niche markets in Specialties and further supported by fundamental market trends. We are dedicated to continue focusing on novel active ingredients and high-value products, expanding our distribution and geographical reach in our Life Science applications and focusing on high-purity and higher margin segments in Advanced Intermediates and Base Chemicals for attractive contracts with increasing capacity. We aim to further increase our operational excellence by focusing on efficiency, strengthening key account and sales functions, ramp-ups of additional capacities and continuous de-bottlenecking, as well as fostering our commercial excellence by winning new customers from large, less reliable competitors in the MCA business.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Deliver de-risked capacity and technology expansion
Subsubsection Text: We will continue to strengthen our strategic positioning in Exclusives and Specialties by focusing on novel active ingredients and investments in state-of-the-art technologies. We believe that we can benefit from a ramp-up in a number of contracted and already invested projects across Exclusives and Specialties products with contractual ‘take-or-pay’ or exclusivity clauses which are underpinned by a well invested asset base that, as a result, significantly reduces the risks associated with their execution. We expect to additionally benefit from leveraging partial cost pass-through mechanisms in future contracts. Consequently, we believe our business is highly resilient and that the predictable customer demand for our CDMO and other highly specialized products offers high visibility on the underlying product lifecycle and returns for a certain part of the portfolio.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Strong focus on client relationships and varied commercial capabilities
Subsubsection Text: We are dedicated to winning new projects by leveraging our long-standing relationships with our blue chip customer base as well as our know-how and reputation as a trusted Western CDMO Crop Science business partner to accelerate and win new contracts as proven in the past. In addition, we plan to further increase our Specialties revenue through a push of our attractive portfolio to additional geographies and customers expanding the volume of our high margin products. Furthermore, as some of our main customer relationships exceed 15 years, we have established ourselves as a key outsourcing partner with trusted supplier status for our clients worldwide who often return to extend existing projects or to collaborate with us on potential new products. As a result, we have very low customer churn, particularly for our Exclusives and Specialties offering, and our top customers work with us for a multitude of individual products. We will continue to strengthen those long-standing customer relationships by working closely with our customers to meet their volume and specification needs for their existing and new products. We intend to expand our production capacity to meet the growing demand of our key customers, continue to optimize our production processes to share efficiency gains and work closely with them to tailor our production processes to new products. We intend to continue to focus on multinational customers and industry leaders, in an effort to benefit from strong innovation and global market penetration opportunities. By further strengthening our relationships with multinational customers who have leading market positions in their industries, we seek to grow with them as they expand their businesses. The introduction of OneCABB has allowed us to further streamline our customers primary points of contact with us and will, we believe, contribute to even stronger customer relationships. 108 -----

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Develop and further expand into additional markets
Subsubsection Text: We remain focused on targeted capacity expansion to capture growing demand and additional production volumes that our customers seek to outsource to us, in line with new growth projects of our customers. Jayhawk, located in the United States, produces customized agricultural, pharmaceutical and specialty chemicals and continues to offer the potential for standalone growth from its existing pipeline portfolio and production of new products, as well as proximity to customers in the Americas. In addition, we believe our Pratteln and Kokkola sites have benefited from cooperation with Jayhawk due to the fact that we can offer various technologies and additional geographies and act in an agile manner according to their needs. By focusing on high quality services, we plan to further capture rising needs in markets which deliver higher margin profiles, for example, pharma, personal care, nutrition and performance materials. This will allow us to capitalize our operating leverage and efficiency gains by, for example, planning to hold plant costs relatively stable despite topline growth. We continue to focus on high capacity utilization as the key success factor for sustainable development, as well as optimized logistics solutions such as the addition of our leased titanium fleet of railcars which will allow for the delivery of more product with fewer railcars due to its lower weight and better loading factor.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Maintain focus on profitability and cash flow
Subsubsection Text: We will continue to focus on improving our profitability through cost savings and efficiency enhancements where possible, such as investments in energy saving measures, footprint optimization and automatization. We believe that there is an ongoing potential for efficiency measures through continuous optimization of our manufacturing processes and recycling streams. We intend to seek to further improve cash flow generation by maximizing the utilization of our production facilities and expanding our production capacity (e.g., in Kokkola and Jayhawk), as well as continuing investments for maintenance to preserve our well-maintained asset base. At the same time, we plan to remain disciplined in our growth capital expenditure projects by securing customers’ longer-term volume commitments in advance and co-investments in the form of upfront capital expenditure or top-up pricing over the terms of customers’ contracts.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Maintain health, safety and environmental excellence
Subsubsection Text: We are committed to a strategy of ESG and sustainability based on environmentally responsible manufacturing processes and ensuring the health and safety of our employees. We aim to benefit from the strong collaboration on ESG and sustainability with customers and industry platforms to improve our sustainability footprint while capitalizing on operating efficiencies. The strong collaboration on ESG in negotiations is based on joint improvement programs further developing our green footprint in our customers’ value chain which, in turn, also contributes to operational efficiencies. Our production facilities in Pratteln and Gersthofen play a significant role in our effort to conserve energy and resources and to reduce emissions and waste. We believe measuring ourselves at a high standard with respect to ESG and sustainability contributes not only to environmental and societal goals but also makes us an even more attractive partner to our business partners in their selection of partners within their value chain. See “Our Business⸺ESG and Sustainability.”

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: The following is a summary of the activities we are currently undertaking in pursuit of these opportunities:

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: 109 ----- Our business has its origins in the chemical production activities of Hoechst AG, which originally commissioned our production facility in Gersthofen, Germany, in 1905 as well as our production facility in Knapsack, Germany, in 1949. In 1997, the Hoechst Specialty Chemicals business was acquired by Clariant. Several years later, in 2003, the CABB Group GmbH was founded as a wholly-owned subsidiary of Clariant before being acquired by an Investment Management in 2005 and then by AXA Private Equity in the following year. In 2007, we acquired SF Chem, including our production facility in Pratteln, Switzerland, which allowed us to expand into contract manufacturing. In 2011, we were acquired by Bridgepoint; that same year we acquired KemFine from 3i and commenced production at our facility in Kokkola, Finland, to further expand our contract manufacturing capabilities. In 2013, we expanded our footprint to Asia through the establishment of a joint venture with Jining Jinwei Gold Power to acquire Jinwei Huasheng Chemicals. We hold a 67% stake in the joint venture entity CABB-Jinwei Specialty Chemicals (Jining) Co., Ltd. In 2014, we were acquired by the Permira Funds and have since invested in an electrolysis plant in Pratteln, capacity expansions and de-bottlenecking in most facilities as well as in a new wastewater facility in China. In 2019, we acquired Evonik Jayhawk Fine Chemicals Corporation, one of the leading fine chemicals companies in the U.S., from Evonik Industries AG. In 2021, we introduced OneCABB, which combined our legacy business units into one integrated company to flatten the organizational structure and drive efficiencies across functions.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: Our production portfolio comprises two product groups: (i) Exclusives and Specialties and (ii) Advanced Intermediates and Base Chemicals. Across these product groups, our offering is primarily focused on novel active ingredients. The following table shows our revenue by product group for the years ended December 31, 2020, 2021 and 2022:

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: Exclusives and Specialties consist of high-value products we offer to our Crop Science and Life Science clients that fully leverage our experience and technical capabilities. Exclusive products include tailor-made solutions for proprietary and innovative active ingredients as well as specialty ingredients and derivatives. Exclusives and Specialties products accounted for €429.3 million or 56.8% of our revenue for the financial year ended December 31, 2022 (2021: €367.3 million or 62.4%; 2020: €312.2 million or 63.4%). _Exclusives_ Exclusives, our CDMO portfolio, consists of mainly products used as active ingredients or intermediates in the Crop Science industry. Underpinning our clear focus on the Crop Science market segment, we manufacture customized active ingredients on an exclusive and confidential basis for our customers and specialize in complex multi-stage processing and quality assurance. Our active ingredients are produced to match our individual customers’ specifications with regard to both their production systems and end product requirements (one customer, one product). These products are usually based on customer-developed IP and thus are tailored, highly complex and technically challenging active ingredients. The active ingredients as well as complex building blocks we produce are used by our customers primarily for herbicides for corn, cotton and sugarcane and insecticides and fungicides for a broad range of applications. We currently manufacture approximately 30 different exclusives for use in agricultural and Crop Science applications, representing a significant driver for our sales and profitability growth. In addition to the Crop Science market, our 110 ----- exclusive custom synthesis products are manufactured for applications in certain specialty end-markets (e.g., animal health). To create these exclusive products, we develop long-term projects and contracts with most of our customers for a large part of our portfolio, characterized initially by capital expenditure commitments or ‘take-or-pay’ clauses to design the custom production facilities required as well as long-term purchase commitments from the customers, providing attractive return profiles. See also “—Our product portfolio.” We contractually obtain customer lock-in from their co-investment in capex or ‘take-or-pay’ clauses, and our customers benefit from our differentiating process know-how. Our multi-year contracts give us high visibility on the underlying product lifecycle and returns for a large part of our portfolio. We serve as the sole supplier for many of our exclusives customers, and our contracts with these customers emphasize volume commitments and/or ‘take-or pay’ clauses particularly at their start. Within our multi-purpose plants we maintain a well-balanced offering across crops and active ingredient types and remain relatively insulated from seasonal fluctuations in demand for any particular crop. We are not materially involved in the production of raw materials or finished product for glyphosate or neonicotinoids. We operate three production facilities capable of producing tailor made products in Exclusives: one in Pratteln, Switzerland, one in Kokkola, Finland and one in Galena, Kansas, United States. See “—Production Facilities.” _Specialties_ Our Specialty portfolio comprises ingredients for Life Science (in particular DCA, GA and CAE) and Performance Materials (in particular BTDA) and targets market segments with expected high customer value-add and growth potential. These include a variety of end-market applications in Life Science including starting materials for innovative pharmaceuticals, actives for cosmetics, building blocks for nutrition supplements and food and beverage ingredients as well as applications in Performance Materials (e.g., for mobile electronic devices and semiconductors). Our products are based on our differentiating technology platforms and our deep understanding of customer application requirements contributing to a strong customer lock-in. We are a leading supplier in the Western world for highly profitable Specialties. Our leading quality levels of our products also provide for further expansion opportunities in Asia. We obtain customer lock-in as a result of our differentiating portfolio for niche applications. For innovative pharmaceuticals, ultra-pure Dichloroacetic Acid (DCA) and Trichloroacetic Acid (TCA) (both of which we produce) are used as a critical starting material for the production of oligonucleotides which are used for novel RNAi based pharmaceuticals, e.g., antisense RNA or small interfering RNA (siRNA). We are the global market leader and only large-scale Western supplier of high purity grade DCA (a key ingredient for RNA-based medication) in Life Science for pharmaceutical applications (by high purity DCA revenue as of 2022) (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). For cosmetic applications, Glycolic acid (GA) is one of our other primary ingredients with a differentiating purity profile. Due to its capability to penetrate skin, glycolic acid has many applications as an active ingredient in skin care and personal care with main applications in anti-aging products such as face masks and peels. In cosmetic grade GA, we are globally the second largest supplier (measured by revenue as of 2022) and the only European producer with global coverage (Company assessment based on the Roland Berger Report). For nutrition supplements and food & beverage ingredients, our portfolio comprises building blocks for the production of vitamins, e.g., vitamin B6, as well as acetates which are used as a buffering agent in various industrial applications and as a preservative or flavor enhancer in the food industry. We maintain a leading market position in the production of CAE (the building blocks for vitamins) due to our strong relationships with key customers (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). In Performance Materials, we supply dianhydrides in a variety of end-markets, including in the semiconductor production and mobile devices including 5G and smart devices, as well as high performance materials for engineering applications, such as those used in fibers for hot gas filtration and for acoustic and thermal insulations. With regards to one of the Performance Materials applications products we produce, BTDA, we are the only large scale ultrapure producer with production footprint in the United States (Roland Berger Report, Company Information). We operate three production facilities capable of producing Specialties: one in Pratteln, Switzerland, one in Gersthofen, Germany and one in Galena, Kansas, United States. See “—Production Facilities.” 111 -----

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: Intermediates are chemical products that require significant expertise and technical equipment to manufacture, which are not produced for one specific customer but have multiple applications across many end-markets and are suitable to many use cases. Intermediates are used in crop protection as well as in pharmaceutical, Life Science and specialized applications such as automotive and detergents. Our Advanced Intermediates offering is predominantly focused on personal care and nutrition within Life Science. Our portfolio comprises mainly monochloroacetic acids (MCA), acid chlorides and chlorine-based products as well as selected base chemicals as by-products generated from our chlor-alkali electrolysis and chlorination processes. Advanced Intermediates and Base Chemicals are produced in highly efficient large-scale production assets in our facilities in Gersthofen and Knapsack, Germany, and in Pratteln, Switzerland as well as in China through our joint venture with Shandong Lutai Chemical Co., Ltd. (formerly Jining Jinwei Gold Power Co., Ltd.). In Knapsack we produce Advanced Intermediates based on a close relationship with a chlorine supplier within the same industrial park. Advanced Intermediates and Base Chemicals accounted for €326.2 million or 43.2% of our revenue for the financial year ended December 31, 2022 (2021: €221.7 million or 37.6%; 2020: €180.1 million or 36.6%). _Advanced Intermediates_ Our Advanced Intermediates portfolio comprises MCA, acid chlorides and chlorine-based products as key product groups. MCA is a key building block for the organic synthesis of ingredients in crop protection applications, Life Sciences, pharmaceuticals as well as in chemical products. We offer customers the full MCA portfolio spanning across all relevant MCA grades up to ultra-pure qualities as well as all relevant formulations such as solutions, melt and MCA salts (SMCA). Our production facilities benefit from state-of-the-art hydrogenation technology. We are one of the largest European Life Science MCA suppliers (measured by production volume in Europe as of 2022). A significant share of our MCA product is produced for captive demand from certain MCA derivatives in the Life Science business. MCA is further used for (captive) Crop Science demand in Exclusives and Specialties business (Roland Berger, Company Information). Our acid chlorides and chlorine-based products portfolio includes products such as chloroacetyl chloride (CAC1) which is used in crop protection applications as well as in pharmaceutical applications (e.g., pain relievers) and various additional acid chlorides and chlorides products which are used in agrochemical synthesis and are also applied in the synthesis of organic peroxides, car tires, sizing agents, flavor and fragrance, high blood pressure medications, antibiotics and animal feed stock additives. _Base Chemicals_ Our chlor-alkali electrolysis processes (used to create key precursors for our Exclusives and Specialties products as well as the advanced intermediates) yields two main co-products: chlorine and caustic soda. In various chlorination processes, chlorine is partially utilized in the process and with the remainder being transformed into hydrogen chloride and hydrochloric acid as solution. We increase our efficiency by selling the caustic soda, hydrochloric acid and other co-products we cannot recycle back into our production processes to third-party customers. Sales of caustic soda are typically made to customers and other third parties through distributors, with the majority of purchasers located within 300 kilometers of our Gersthofen and Pratteln sites due to transportation costs. The market is partially protected as logistics costs limit longer distance shipping. In Switzerland, where we are the only producer of caustic soda, we sell a substantial part of our base products via pipeline to tenants of the Schweizerhalle industrial cluster based on long-term contracts, offering superior supply reliability.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Uses for our products in Crop Science
Subsubsection Text: In 2022, based on internal assessments, we estimate that approximately 50% of our products were used in the Crop Science market (measured as a percentage of revenues). Chemicals we produce are used by our clients to develop herbicides protecting multiple crops including maize, soybean, sunflower, sugarcane and fruits and vegetables. As a result we maintain an offering across crops and we have benefited in parts of our portfolio from the decrease in some existing generics under regulatory and public scrutiny by producing replacement products. We are not materially involved in the production of raw materials or finished product for glyphosate or neonicotinoids.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Uses for our products in Life Science
Subsubsection Text: In 2022, based on internal assessments, we estimate that approximately 20% of our products were used in the Life Science market (measured as a percentage of revenues). We believe that the addressable markets for our products within Life Science will grow until 2027 due to featured noteworthy developments in specific segments with high demand, such as: novel RNA therapeutics, vitamins and supplements as well as rising adoption in skin care products as detailed below. _RNA-based Pharma Applications_ We are a leading Dichloroacetic acid (or DCA) producer used for RNA and oligonucleotide applications, with DCA being an essential input for the production of RNA from DNA. DCA helps to synthesize nucleic acids that are then used in numerous therapeutic active pharmaceutical ingredients in various phases of clinical trials and few products already in commercial stage (Roland Berger, Company Information). The DCA market is highly differentiated by its level of purity and through our state-of-the-art facilities, we are able to produce the highest purity levels and managed to fulfill the emergent demand for DCA in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Main RNA-based market growth drivers are investments in research and development to improve genomic technologies as well as the broadening the field of application (e.g. “oligonucleotide therapeutics”). As a result of further uses of DCA in the chemical synthesis of oligonucleotides and broader commercial application of the therapeutics, the addressable market is forecasted to grow by a wide range between 2022 and 2027 (Roland Berger, Company Information). For more information on projected growth and key market drivers, see “Industry and _Market Data⸺Life Science⸺General⸺DCA” and “Industry and Market Data⸺Life Science⸺General⸺DCA Key Drivers.” Building blocks for vitamins_ Our product CAE is used as the basis for Vitamin B6 synthesis used, for example, for nutrition. The vitamins market is estimated to grow between 2022 and 2027 (3% to 4% market value CAGR). Key drivers that support this growth include: (i) an increased focus on preventative health care; (ii) a rise of personalized and functional nutrition; and (iii) the use of vitamins in animal food (Roland Berger). _Skin care_ We are a key supplier of high purity Glycolic Acid for fast-growing skin care applications, e.g., anti-aging and deep facial cleansers, with the market for skincare products expected to grow between 2022 and 2027 (market value CAGR of 3% to 4% from 2022 to 2025 and 4% to 6% from 2025 to 2027). Key drivers that support this growth include: (i) a rising focus on personal appearance and related beauty products, particularly in the emerging markets; (ii) new care product developments of personal care players; and (iii) a continued usage of Glycolic Acid in personal care products (e.g. anti-age products) in combination with an aging population (Roland Berger). _Personal care, packaged food & pharma_ We are one of the largest European Life Science MCA suppliers (by production volume in Europe as of 2022). The personal care market is expected to grow between 2022 and 2027 (4% to 5% market CAGR by volume in k tons). Key drivers that support this growth include: (i) a higher demand for hygiene products due to increasing awareness for hygiene and cleanliness as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic; (ii) changing consumer preferences from solid to liquid products; and (iii) the continued usage of CMC as a thickening agent or stabilizer in food and beverages (Roland Berger). 113 -----

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Uses for our products in Performance Materials
Subsubsection Text: In 2022, based on internal assessments, we estimate that approximately 15% of our products were used in the Performance Materials market (measured as a percentage of revenues). Performance materials are used in the creation of curatives in epoxies, polyimides, polyesters and other resin systems. These products have multiple applications such as the coating and protection of electronic components as well as in producing composites and adhesives, with common uses in electronic components, semiconductors, electric motor components and industrial coating. Furthermore, Performance Materials created with our products include composites, fibers, films, and foams that provide heat and electrical resistance and stability under aggressive conditions. End-uses of such Performance Materials include, among others: flexible printed circuitry and foldable displays for smart devices, composite components for automotive and aviation, thermal insulation for aircraft and marine vessels, coatings and tubing for medical devices and radiation shielding for spacecraft. Our products cater to the niche applications in mobile electronics, transportation and green energy. Specifically, we supply (i) certain dianhydrides (BTDA and 6FDA) and (ii) one product which eventually goes into the semiconductor end-market. Moreover, BTDA is used for numerous applications in electronics, infrastructure and transportation with limited competition. With regards to BTDA, we are the only large scale ultrapure producer with production footprint in the United States (Roland Berger). For more information on growth rates and key drivers, see “Industry and _Market Data⸺Performance Materials⸺Specialty Anhydrides⸺General” and “Industry and Market Data⸺Performance Materials⸺Electronic Performance Materials Product⸺General.”_

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Uses for our products in Base Chemicals
Subsubsection Text: In 2022, based on internal assessments, we estimate that approximately 15% of our products were used in Base Chemicals (measured as a percentage of revenues, includes MCA used across industries for further refinement). Base Chemicals are produced as by-products generated from our chlor-alkali electrolysis and chlorination processes and primarily consist of two main products: chlorine and sodium hydroxide (caustic soda). Caustic soda is used in the production of various other intermediate products, for example, in chemicals to manufacture organic chemicals as a dehydrochlorinating agent, catalyst or neutralization agent (Roland Berger). We believe that caustic soda demand is structurally outgrowing production capacities in Europe due to various technology shifts. Enduses of such Base Chemicals include, among others, the pulp and paper and alumina industry. For more information on growth rates and key drivers, see “Industry and Market Data⸺Sodium Hydroxide.”

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: Our product portfolio has a number of applications across our major end-markets, Crop Science, Life Science and Performance Materials and the growth of these underlying addressable markets is a contributing factor to our results. 112 -----

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: We try to closely manage our project tenders and open offers, prioritizing large-scale growth projects for our Exclusives products and advantageous Specialties contracts. As a result, we regularly review our open tenders as well as ongoing projects against key investment metrics, checking if our production capacity is used effectively. Between 2020 and 2022, we received approximately 200 project inquiries across all our business operations (Exclusives, Specialties and Advanced Intermediates). After evaluating the individual characteristics of each potential project, 13 potential projects were further developed in the same period through to the offer stage, where we tender an offer for a given customer product. In the selection process, we benefit from a proven reliability record and trusted supplier status in the market, underpinned by our strong technology and execution capabilities as well as standout client services. We believe these act as distinguishing factors in the tender process, particularly when compared to competitors in Western and Asian markets. 114 ----- Over the last three years, we have established a track record of consistent project wins (at least one major 1[st] campaign project per year), building upon our deep integration into our customers’ value chains and our reputation of reliability and ability to manage complex processes. In the same period, we generally signed an additional one to two other Exclusive or Specialties products contracts to further strengthen utilization and returns of our installed asset base with limited investment requirements.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Title: Key targets for investment criteria and capex requirements applicable to our CDMO Exclusives projects
Subsubsection Text: Tailor-made products based on customer-developed IP require custom-built production lines and close cooperation with our customers to achieve the requested quality, volume and product specification. This requires significant ramp-up times and costs to set-up appropriate production lines and processes. We contractually commit to such long-term projects (under contractual frameworks) for a large part of our portfolio with the expectation that we will recover our initial investments in the short-term and achieve attractive returns and profitability growth in the mid- to long-term. If we successfully find projects that match our targeted key investment criteria, we stand to benefit from increased profitability and visibility on the underlying product lifecycle and returns. We aim to find projects that allow an EBITDA pay-back of our capex investment in approximately three years from the start of production. To achieve this, we seek a minimum contractual length for CDMO projects in Exclusives, as well as include other mechanisms (e.g., co-investments by customers) to ensure the recovery of our capex. Our customers cover part of our incurred capex either through initial co-investments or through ‘take-orpay’ clauses committing our customers’ to minimum purchase volumes and prices. This co-investment helps integrate our services into our customers’ value chains and adds to their potential cost to switch suppliers, which generally drives very-high project renewal rates. Our typical CDMO contract models follow one of two contract templates: we either engage in CDMO contracts featuring a facility fee, where customers take on a share of the initial capex investment and our project margins are in line with market levels or, as an alternative, we provide CDMO contracts featuring an offtake arrangement, where the initial capex investment is largely funded by us and our desired return profile is achieved through ‘take-or pay’ contract provisions. As a result, the customer has a limited capex commitment upfront but through a firm offtake arrangement, the customer commits to purchase a certain amount of our future output for an extended period (typically five years). These CDMO contracts usually feature higher product margins to compensate for our larger upfront capex commitment and are oftentimes renewed before the end of their initial term. Furthermore, before committing our capacity to a given long-term project, we try to assess the projected internal rate of return (IRR) of each new project over the span of its predicted lifecycle, and aim to select advantageous returns (IRR targets of 25%). While this is not achieved in all our projects, we aim to strengthen our product portfolio over time with projects that either match our key criteria or otherwise offer strategic opportunities.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: Due to contractual commitments and yearly purchase schedules, we have a strong visibility over the underlying product lifecycle and returns of a large part of our Exclusives products. As of March 31, 2023, we also had 14 projects in varying ramp-up phases, which are expected to contribute to our revenue and profitability growth in the short to medium term.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: Our Exclusives and Specialties business model is built around a strong product portfolio of customer orders and long-term projects for a large part of our portfolio, supporting high visibility of the underlying product lifecycle and returns. We generate a significant amount of our Group’s profitability from our CDMO activities in the Exclusives product group through long-term projects for our customers. To a smaller extent, our Specialties contracts are also a strong contributor to profitability. In Exclusives, we also benefit from de-risked growth capex investments as customers contribute to the capex required to set up productions (e.g., co-investment undertakings by customer or ‘take-or-pay’ commitments). This also adds to such customers’ switching costs and helps create long lasting relations due to our integration in their supply chain and generally results in very low customer churn and high contract renewal rates for our Exclusives products.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: We are a trusted supplier to a broad base of many established companies, including leading Crop Science, Life Sciences and specialty chemical companies who rely on our solutions for their own products and applications. We have developed long-standing relationships with our key customers, which in many cases span several decades. Our customer relationships benefit from our close integration into our customers’ supply chain and co-investments from key customers into production facilities through their longer-term commitments for certain products. We also benefit from rising outsourcing trends, particularly for our Crop Science customers, as they shift their businesses to asset-light, R&D-centric models. We are regarded as a strategic supplier to some of our top customers, which involves close cooperation with the customer in terms of process development and demand planning. We believe that we are a “key supplier” for several of our customers, which makes us an important partner to the customer and help us to maintain our stable customer base. Moreover, we believe that such supply contracts are less volatile than top-up contracts and substantial capex investment, tiered pricing and constant yield improvement result in higher switching costs for customers to later source products from other suppliers. This has resulted in very low customer churn rates. In 2021 and 2022, we had an overall average customer retention rate of approximately 98% (based on existing 115 ----- customer revenue over total revenue for the respective year) which illustrates, together with the high rate of contract renewal and lock-in effects, the “stickiness” of our topline in Exclusives. Within the Advanced Intermediates portfolio of the Advanced Intermediates and Base Chemicals product group, our products have the following estimated amount of customers as of 2022: (i) for MCA we serve over 50 customers; (ii) for SMCA we serve approximately 50 customers; and (iii) for Chloroacetyl Chloride (CAC1) we serve approximately 15 customers. In Specialties, our customer base includes more than 60 accounts and in hydrochloric acid (Base Chemicals) more than 30. Our average duration of business relationships with our top four customers in Crop Science exceeds 15 years in tenure (based on management estimates between 2020 and 2022) and a number of our Crop Science blue-chip relationships span more than 30 years.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: We operate six production facilities across Germany, Switzerland, the United States, Finland and China. These are located in Pratteln (Switzerland), Kokkola (Finland), Galena (Kansas, United States), Gersthofen (Germany) and Knapsack (Germany) and Jining, Shandong Province (China). The following table sets out certain information related to our production facilities as of December 31, 2022:

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: We acquired our Pratteln site through the acquisition of SF-Chem in 2007. It is located close to Basel, Switzerland on approximately 168,829 square meters. The Pratteln site is a custom synthesis production facility with a focus on our Exclusives portfolio offering several multi-purpose production lines and dedicated single purpose production plants including scale-up capabilities. However, the multi-purpose nature of the plant means that we regularly service all product groups and all end-markets from this location. Our production facilities at Pratteln offer backward integration of our Exclusives portfolio into a number of the raw materials including a chlor-alkali plant and rail and highway transport connections for customer supply chain integration. Most of the chlorine required for chlorination is produced on site, while MCA is sourced from our Knapsack and Gersthofen facilities and transported by rail to our Pratteln production facilities, where it is an important raw material for one of the key active ingredients in agrochemicals Exclusives. Pratteln’s integrated production system enables recovery of by-products and exhaust to improve efficiency and our sustainability proposition by minimizing energy needs and waste.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: We acquired our Kokkola site through the acquisition of KemFine in August 2011. The site is located in a large chemical industrial complex in the industrial area of Kokkola on approximately 142,000 square meters. The Kokkola site is a custom synthesis production facility mainly for our agrochemicals in our Exclusives portfolio offering several highly automated multi-purpose production lines. The production lines comprise a total batch reactor volume of approximately 550 cubic meters supported by a strong site infrastructure and including in-house incineration capabilities. Combining large-scale production capacities and infrastructure, a high degree of automatization and an operational track record, our Kokkola site offers improved economics for our existing products as well as for our 116 ----- new growth projects. Furthermore, our Kokkola site derives its energy supply entirely from wind and hydropower. In January 2023, we committed to an investment of €50 million by 2025, including the contribution of a new office building as well as measures to reduce CO2 emissions, e.g., a modification of our waste incineration plant, which underlines our commitment to sustainability.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: The Jayhawk facility is located in Galena, Kansas on approximately 3.3 million square meters, of which 202,000 square meters are used. Jayhawk has state-of-the-art facilities for Exclusives and Specialties products with high growth potential based on its existing portfolio and the ramping up of new products. The Jayhawk site offers several custom synthesis production lines mainly for our Exclusives portfolio as well as dedicated production lines for Performance Materials. Jayhawk produces active ingredients and Intermediates for the Crop Science and Life Science end-markets. Jayhawk also produces Specialties and Performance Materials products for high growth markets. Our Specialties products have high-performance applications, e.g., in electronics. As a result of acquiring our Jayhawk production facility in 2019, we have gained additional U.S. exposure and have gained further fine chemicals customers beyond the agrochemicals market. This, we believe, has positioned us as the only major Crop Science CDMO with a transatlantic footprint.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: Our Knapsack site located near Cologne, Germany, has been in production since 1949 and covers approximately 10,900 square meters. It is situated in a chemical industrials park with transportation connections to Western and Central Europe and access to North Sea shipping routes by rail, highway and waterway. Our Knapsack facility uses chlorination and hydrogenation technology to produce MCA and SMCA. Chlorine and hydrogen are sourced via pipeline under a supply agreement from our supplier’s adjacent facilities. The facility has a two-line production process, which allows for maintenance and repair activities, and produces multiple purity grades of MCA as liquid, solutions and flakes.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: Our Gersthofen site, situated in the Gersthofen Industrial Park located approximately 60 kilometers northwest of Munich near Augsburg, Germany, has been in production since 1905 and occupies approximately 31,500 square meters. The facility has multiple production lines and produces multiple purity grades of MCA and as well as proprietary ingredients of our Specialties portfolio focusing mainly on pharmaceutical and Life Science applications. Our Gersthofen facility produces chlorine on-site using backward integrated chlor-alkali membrane electrolysis technology, offering backward integration for MCA as well as for our Specialties products. The chlorine production generates by-products such as caustic soda, which is sold to third-party customers or reacted with acetic acid to produce sodium acetate. In December 2019, we upgraded the Gersthofen plant with the latest and most efficient membrane technology allowing for additional capacity and continuous energy saving.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsubsection Text: We acquired our site in China in 2014 following the establishment of our joint venture with Jining Jinwei Gold Power in 2013. The production facility is centrally located in Northeast China in the Shandong Province west of Beijing and Shanghai. We replaced the original technical grade MCA plant in 2016 with a high-purity grade MCA plant making use of our differentiating hydrogenation technology and allowing us to serve premium international customers. We benefit from a stable supply of chlorine from a nearby large (electrolysis) chlorine plant owned and operated by our joint venture partner, with CABB GmbH owning 68% of the share capital in the joint venture.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA

In addition to our production facilities above, we maintain sales offices in Charlotte, North Carolina (USA) and Shanghai (China). Our production facilities are described below in greater detail.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
Subsection Title: Sources and Availability of Raw Materials
Subsubsection Text: Some of our customer contracts by sales include price formulas that allow for partial pass-through of price variations in acetic acid and acetic anhydride. These pass-through provisions help to limit significant fluctuations in our cost of sales but often include a time lag. The remaining revenue from the sale is contracted at spot prices that reflect current prices for raw materials, which mitigates our exposure to fluctuations in raw materials prices. For tailor-made products, raw materials for production are provided by our customers or, where we are responsible for the procurement of raw materials, our customer contracts may include pass-through clauses for raw materials, thereby providing a certain degree of protection from fluctuations in prices of raw materials. Purchases of raw materials primarily consist of acetic acid, acetic anhydride, chlorine and energy. The chlorine production process based on chlor-alkali electrolysis at our Gersthofen and Pratteln production facilities requires 117 ----- significant amounts of electricity. At our Knapsack plant, we purchase chlorine via pipeline pursuant to a supply contract from Vinnolit, whose chlorine production facility is adjacent to ours. Similarly, our joint venture in China sources its chlorine requirements from our joint venture partner, who operates an adjacent chlorine production facility. As part of our quality control management procedures, we maintain long-term relationships with suppliers for large parts of the portfolio. We also conduct ongoing performance assessment and benchmarking as part of our supplier selection process. In the event of supply shortages, we may seek to purchase raw materials or other products from our competitors. From time to time, we also enter into product swap agreements with key competitors to guarantee that our customers can be supplied at all times, even during facility maintenance or turnarounds. While temporary shortages of raw materials could occasionally occur, we generally have access to sufficient raw materials to cover current and projected requirements.

Section Title: INDUSTRY AND MARKET DATA
